pageContext.claim: “Look, we have there's never been anything like it. If you think again, by the end, we have 40 or 50. We have many people in there waiting to be confirmed right now for federal judgeships. That's a big deal, a federal judge. And don't forget, President Obama left us over a hundred. It's unheard of. He left us over a hundred. Because he probably thought that crooked Hillary was going to win. And, you know, in which case it wouldn't have mattered too much.”
pageContext.analysis: There were 88 district and 17 court of appeals vacancies when Trump took office, so a total of 105 -- not through Obama's lack of effort. Senate Republicans refused to move on his nominations.
